page.title: 05PARISH COUNCIL IN CLATFORD
page.content: The{Parish}Council is in charge of the village,they look after rivers,paths,foot bridges,parks and village facilities.Anyone over 18 can be voted for,in an election to be a councillor.There are 10 councillors and a clerk,none of them get paid except the clerk.The council is divided into groups.Each group is in charge of a subject,e.g. group 1-paths,2-rivers,3-bridges,4-parks and facilities. The Parish Council is the last in the rung of governmental authority.The{ {Government}at Westminster is the most important followed by the{County} Council,followed by the{Borough} Council then the Parish Council.
